title: OK what is the deal with Ranked?
body:
I am playing my first ranked games in some time, still Unranked, I thought ranked was supposed to be 'better' than normals.

Better players, not just champion kill, but picks, who goes where, attitude, anything.

So far all I have gotten are trolls. I'm not going to elaborate, but fucking fuckers in ranked are making me hate this game.

replies.body: People in ranked are generally less tolerant of mistakes than people in normals.

This ^

 I expect far smarter play and builds from ranked players than I do in normals, unfortunately disappointing 90% of the time :3

It's supposed to be better, but judging from being unranked, you're being teamed with either other unranked/bronze elo players. Bronze is practically 'normals' elo, but if you make any mistakes you are SET ON FIRE.

As a newly entered plat summoner, I can tell you the time I was first unranked and in Bronze. I was put into Bronze 2, but quickly fell through the floor to Bronze 5. I stayed here a lot. I was bad. Basically, my tip is you can't trust ANYONE else on your team in Bronze or Silver to be good/make right decisions/communicate etc. EXPECT TROLLS! You have to improve yourself and your gameplay and carry your team, and ultimately carry yourself out of elo hell.

~More helpful tips: be ready to fill. Don't be some douchebag who can only play one role or feed. You can announce your prefered role, but that might be someone else's preferred role, who picks before you, and you will have to deviate to another role.
~When filling, practice champs for every role, and know certain matchups/counterpicks. You don't have to counterpick every single time, having champions you know well and are good at will be better than some counterpick you've never played before.
~Upgrade your trinkets at level 9! Yes, even in Plat, people don't seem to think upgrading trinkets is important, IT'S GAMECHANGING. Having one stinky base ward trink is not enough: upgrade that for a mere 250g and you have a 2 charge Sightstone that recharges without having to go b.
~Map awareness. Call out flash timers, call out where the enemy jungler was last seen. Use pings, but don't ever spam them. You'll get yourself ignored and reported at the end of the game.

Those are just a few tips, there are a tonne more, but ultimately as I've said, at that low elo you need to carry yourself out. You'll have a load of crappy games, trust me, but you'll get lucky and climb through the ranks at some point. Also, when next season clocks around, don't play ranked right at the start - there are a bunch more trolls and bad players on at the start checking out the fresh season that will screw your games up. I was Silver at the start of this season and couldn't climb out due to this.

Hope I've helped mate, I know the feeling, and good luck! {{champion:254}}

Good tips, thank you, but as you know, if you don't get your preferred lane or champion, or someone who can actually carry, you are pretty fucked.

I play top or jungle a lot, I can Mid quite well and do OK at AD, but have always, and I mean ALWAYS sucked ass as support, no matter how much in the past I tried it, I just can't do it.

That said, I win my lane a lot, most of the time I ignore the other lanes if I am top unless my lane partner roams. More times than not I will keep my lane partner pushed and force ganks, yet more times than not, my team also loses their lane and start going ape shit.

My last game was the same, I won top as Gnar Vs. Rammus, really quite easy and avoiding their Udyr ganks was a piece of cake, he tried about 6 times in ¬15 minutes while I had 1 gank for 1 kill.

in the meantime mid and bot both lost lane and while mid had a lot of kills, he was also dying a lot, 14/16 by end game and was toxic from about 10 minutes to the end, roughly half an hour of non stop shit talk.

If I don't get my lane and champion choice, and get a few early kills and CS, I can only hope my team does or no matter how well I play, I just can't carry. I have tried the Jungle path in the past, just focus on jungle as much as I can and while it worked well for myself, again if your team falls over, not much you can do.

Yeah, I feel ya mate. It's a massive disadvantage in higher elo compared to lower elo's when a lane goes really bad. It topples the balance of the game, and when teamfights come around more often than not they come out on top due to a fed lane that they had.

More often than not, when I'm not in bot lane, they go extremely bad. When I am in bot lane, we do well, buuut they're jungler ganks more than our jungler ganks, or better yet mid lane rotates down and we weren't given ample warning. Or what is even BETTER is when they're jungler, AND mid laner gank us, or jungler and top lane tp's in. Eugh it's a pain in the ass.

Well, from what you've said, keep practicing Support, perhaps in normals. It's not particularly hard, and there is lots of tips to come with that, but it is definately a carry role. Maybe try picks such as Leona, Soraka, Nautilus etc.

Just keep practicing, practice makes perfect! ~And just ignore shit talk, it exists in every elo and they just do it to piss you off, and that reduces your gameplay capability.

Look, I'm only in Silver, but if I could offer up a tip on how I got to S5 from B5, take one champion you love, preferably a versatile one that can carry a game, and then learn the fuck outta that champ and pick that champ as much as possible and then carry yourself on said champ.

My 2 best are Yi jungle and Garen top, GG to me. I fI don't have some support, Yi falls over and Garen, banned most games or picked before me, or I don't even get those lanes.

Bronze is full of those who yap off and state how good they are, or how they are not actually silver yet suck harder than a bronze.

Any advice on what champions can go in multiple roles and still carry?

Yi is great! One of the best low elo solo queue carries in this meta tbh. Garen in this meta is also great! But, if you wanted champs in multiple roles... Kayle is pretty good! I was something of a Kayle main last season and I loved playing her, she can go top, jungle and mid comfortably. And she CAN bot lane too, just requires lot of practice. Another great one is Wukong. Top lane and Jungle Wu are very common and very strong, but, mid lane Wukong, is actually fucking terrifying man. Yasuo can both top and mid and if you really wanted to, you could even jungle him. Nidalee, top, jungle and mid. Cho, can top, jungle and mid. And, this would require an insane amount of practice, but Lulu can go in every single role and wreck. Top, mid and support Lulu are very common, but Jungle Lulu and AD Carry Lulu are not, but, are actually pretty good if played right.

I'm S1 on this account, I was being placed with plat 5+ and being the only silver in the game and 2 leagues/ranks below they felt the need to blame me for their stuff ups. I'm adc all the way in the bot lane, our jg gets invaded and its my fault and they just feed because they don't like silvers lol, I thought if you got past gold at least you would find people with common sense but from the teams I've been placed with, they are clueless as fuck.{{champion:36}}

Always remember that the behavior and attitudes within ranked are all subjective - I find just being open with communication and positively encouraging my team helps a great deal. Relax when people get testy and try to encourage them. 

I play by the mantra "killing someone with kindness" and It works out OK.
lol encouraging them aint gonna work ive met guys who say "say one more word to me and ill afk" so they get pretty tense in game and its usually better to ignore them

People in ranked care more about winning. Because of this they get frustrated more easily and are more likely to flame/troll/afk when things aren't going their way or they see someone else as hurting their chances of winning.
true
The whole ranked system is faulted. If you just enjoy playing the game then normal is a much better mode.
Placement matches are filled with trolls. It gets a LOT better after 10 games. But even then, ranked in general is more troll than normals. Just a fact. And yes, my name.

I am about to give up on ranked, it is seriously worse than normals.

I don't care for the skill, players can be bad, but those who complain all day about the other players or go AFK because "you are all bad" IS the problem.
:D

It's not just the trolls or the butthurt kids, it's the plethora of AFK's that also ruin it. It's almost like the guys in normals are trying to get better and actually play, whilst those in ranked are only there because they just hit level 30 and brought 16 champions and are "New to ranked and still need to learn".

More like new to the game and need to have their heads checked.

Problem with these kids is that they had a bad time in ranked and so seek to ruin important games for other people.

Not much you can do but pity them
